keyTakeAways: Lance Bass has type 1.5 diabetes, also known as latent autoimmune diabetes of adulthood (LADA).
He uses the Dexcom G7 Continuous Glucose Monitoring System to manage his blood sugar levels effectively.
Bass created an online persona called 'Blood Sugar Lance' to educate the public about diabetes with humor, which developed accidentally during social media interactions.
He identifies white rice and white bread as foods that significantly spike his blood sugar, even with minimal consumption.
His uncle had type 1 diabetes, which influenced his early awareness of diabetes and healthy eating habits.
Technology and the support of the diabetic community have significantly improved his ability to manage his condition.
Stress, especially from his busy career and parenting his four-year-old twins, can negatively affect his blood sugar levels.
Despite public speculation about an *NSYNC reunion, Lance Bass has confirmed there is no current plan for such a tour.
He has expressed skepticism about sensationalized media reports on *NSYNC reunions, saying they often misrepresent the facts.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Lance Bass, a former *NSYNC member, shares personal insights into living with type 1.5 diabetes (LADA), emphasizing how modern technology like the Dexcom G7 Continuous Glucose Monitoring System has transformed his daily management. He created the online persona 'Blood Sugar Lance' on Instagram to educate the public with humor and relatability, particularly highlighting how foods like white rice and white bread spike his blood sugar. Though fans speculate about a *NSYNC reunion, Bass confirms there is no current plan, dismissing media reports as inaccurate. The article underscores the personal, emotional, and technological challenges of managing diabetes, especially in the context of a demanding career and family life with his four-year-old twins.
title: Lance Bass Has More to Say About Living with Diabetes Than He Does About an *NSYNC Reunion
